title: Legit question, How many of you never tilt.
body:
This board seems to demonize ragers, but legitemately how many of you can honestly say that in every single game of league you have ever played not once have you gotten angry at your team for one reason or another.

There is a difference between someone who tilts off the face of the planet when they are instigated.

And someone whos just plain toxic.

infact 90% of the "toxicity" in this game would be solved by just removing the players that aggravate the tilters.

Hence why i keep calling for more accountability in the ranked queue.

If i had to guess based on the players ive experienced.

10% of ranked players actually care about improving and try to win.
50% are just there to have fun and seem to be completely oblivious to the existence of the normals queue.
30% of players are brand new to ranked or just so insanely bad that they will never ever climb unless they get coaching.
and the remaining 20% are legitimately toxic players.

I would without a doubt, smash my credit card down, throw my wallet at my monitor, and provide 100 points of id, for a ranked queue where the only other people in that queue also paid the "no fucktards" tax

Then i would happily wait 2 hours while it tries to queue me with the other 20 people in my elo who actually give two shits about climbing.

Fun Fact: 83% of statistics you see online are made up!

But to be serious for a moment, I get angry at teams a lot of the time. I'd estimate at least a quarter of my games (and not just in LoL). The difference is, I don't take out that anger on people. I vent it through outlets that I've come to rely on, which for me is (mainly) Video Games, which might seem contradictory, but it works for me. I don't always play multiplayer games, and when I play solo, that's when I'm working out my anger and frustration.
